resources.string: Allows a joystick to control a virtual mouse cursor
Allows the use of a joystick or gamepad to control a mouse cursor in order to interact with this device.
Once enabled, moving the right thumbstick will move the mouse cursor. Pulling the left trigger while moving the cursor will cause it to move faster.

Pulling the right trigger will simulate a finger down. If the trigger is released quickly, it will emulate a tap at the cursor position. If the trigger is held and then released, it will act as a long press. If the trigger is held and the cursor is moved slightly, it will be interpreted as a drag. If the cursor is moved further, it will act as a fling gesture.
Pulling both the left and right triggers while pressing both shoulder buttons will toggle the virtual mouse on and off.
• `LEFT SHOULDER` while holding left trigger: switch to previous display device
• `RIGHT SHOULDER` while holding left trigger: switch to next display device
The JoyMouse service must be enabled in accessibility settings.
Some additional permissions are requested to operate this application:
An icon showing a mouse cursor
Allow an overlay to be rendered showing the cursor position
